Napier City Rovers juggernaut rolls on: Teen Sam Lack proves super sub https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/play-it-again-sam-teenager-sam-lack-proves-super-sub-as-rovers-juggernaut-rolls-on/WKTR5PTHNZGBPNZVMAO4DHTF5Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/play-it-again-sam-teenager-sam-lack-proves-super-sub-as-rovers-juggernaut-rolls-on/WKTR5PTHNZGBPNZVMAO4DHTF5Q/ Teen helps Napier City Rovers unleash 45 minutes of football pain on Wellington opponents. Tue, 25 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Sam Lack proved to be a game-changer for Napier City Rovers during their Central League clash against Waterside Karori. He came off the bench at halftime when his side was down 1-0, before inspiring them to an eventual 7-1 win at Bluewater Stadium. Photo / Neil Reid
Second-half goal blitz sinks Gisborne United in Fed Cup semis https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/26/second-half-goal-blitz-sinks-gisborne-united-in-fed-cup-semis/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/26/second-half-goal-blitz-sinks-gisborne-united-in-fed-cup-semis/ John GilliesUnited beaten 4-1 after leading at halftime in Napier Tue, 25 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Gisborne United strike Josh Adams, in action against Napier Marist, put his side ahead in their Central Fed Cup semifinal against Taranaki Premiership leaders Moturoa in Napier on Saturday. But Moturoa came back strongly in the second half to win 4-1. Photo / Paul Rickard

Safety training for isolated Tairāwhiti farmers as bridge repairs drag on https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/26/safety-training-for-isolated-tairawiti-farmers-as-bridge-repairs-drag-on/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/26/safety-training-for-isolated-tairawiti-farmers-as-bridge-repairs-drag-on/ Zita Campbell, Local Democracy ReporterOngoing wait taking a mental toll on stricken farmers. Tue, 25 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Bridging Tairawhiti group members, made up of farmers isolated due to bridges washed away during Cyclone Gabrielle took part in a first aid training course last week while they continue to wait for the council-owned public bridges attached to their properties to be fixed. Ian and Helen Burgess are pictured performing CPR on a training manikin.
